alert.note: Alert for Sabine; San Augustine (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 6:12AM CST until January 26 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Texas... Ayish Bayou Near San Augustine affecting Sabine and San Augustine Counties. For the Ayish Bayou...including San Augustine...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast through this morning. Minor flooding is forecast through tomorrow morning. * WHERE...Ayish Bayou near San Augustine. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Secondary roads near the bayou will flood and be barricaded. Moderate to severe lowland flooding will continue for at least a couple of days. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 16.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:15 AM CST Wednesday was 16.1 feet. - Forecast...The river should fall below 16 feet later this morning and is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 7.3 feet early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 615 AM CST.
